channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carmelo Anthony reflects on Hall of Fame career, investing wins and passing on Google and crypto: ‘That’s another one I should have went with my gut on’
item.description: The NBA legend talked to Fortune about his business career, his investments, NIL rights and more: "Now, I don't think these kids really enjoy that mom...

item.title: Home of Ukraine’s Lead Negotiator Is Searched in Corruption Case
item.description: The scrutiny of Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff, could disrupt U.S.-led peace talks and further rattle Ukrainian politics...

item.title: Death Toll Rises to 128 in Hong Kong High-Rise Fire
item.description: Hope of finding survivors has dwindled, with many residents of the densely packed Wang Fuk Court apartment towers still unaccounted for.

item.title: Two Gen Zers turned down millions from Elon Musk to build an AI based on the human brain—and it’s outperformed models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: William Chen and Guan Wang believe they will be the first ones to build artificial general intelligence.

item.title: Europe’s most popular sign of Christmas is a star that’s been handmade for over 180 years by one of the world’s oldest Protestant denominations
item.description: You already know the Moravian Star, even if you don't know where it's from or why it looks so distinctively beautiful.

item.title: I went to COP30—and saw how the rest of the world is pushing climate action even as the U.S. steps back
item.description: Amid the diplomatic gridlock, perhaps the real story of COP30 was happening outside the negotiation halls.

item.title: Futures and Treasuries markets on CME black out overnight, after a glitch at an all-important data centre
item.description: "BrokerTec EU markets are open and trading. All other CME Group markets remain halted due to a data center cooling issue at CyrusOne," CME told Fortun...

item.title: Worker Cleared of Stealing Snacks From Office Fridge After 2 Years in Court
item.description: A South Korean man accused of stealing a Choco Pie and a mini custard cake was acquitted after a prosecution that drew widespread criticism.

item.title: Death Toll Rises to 128 in Hong Kong High-Rise Fire
item.description: Hope of finding survivors has dwindled, with many residents of the densely packed Wang Fuk Court apartment towers still unaccounted for.

item.description: The scrutiny of Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff, could disrupt U.S.-led peace talks and further rattle Ukrainian politics...

item.title: Goodbye, Price Tags. Hello Dynamic Pricing.
item.description: Shopping has always been a game. And now it’s being rigged against you.

item.title: Aftershocks of an Epic Art Crime Reverberate in Japan
item.description: At least four works by a famous convicted forger have been discovered in Japan. Transparency about the mistakes, however, has sparked as much curiosit...

item.title: ‘Hey, Lemonade!’: A Backstage Fixture at the Grand Ole Opry
item.description: Legions of backstage workers have helped the Grand Ole Opry thrive for a century in Nashville. Diana McBride is known for her lemonade — and much more...

item.title: Hondurans Fear Unrest Ahead of Election as Trump Endorses a Candidate
item.description: On Sunday, voters will choose between a left-wing presidential candidate and two conservatives, one backed by President Trump. The results are likely ...
